body_text:
In /recpie-server/contract-tests there is a testrail.cfg.dist file. To enable reporting of results to TestRail, that file needs to be modified and the following values added to it:

email address for TestRail user (I suggest creating a Normandy-specific one)
password for TestRail user
assignedto_id is the TestRail ID for the user

Then the results can be reported by adding the following CLI options to the pytest command already being used:

--testrail=testrail.cfg to use the TestRail config file
--no-ssl-cert-check so that Python doesn't complain about the self-signed SSL certificate being used by our TestRail instance

You'll notice that are tests in test_heartbeat that have a @testrail annotation. Any tests that don't have one already will need one. You can set those test cases up in TestRail itself and then add the necessary annotation.
Happy to answer any questions about all this.

title: Enable reporting of tests to TestRail
body:
In /recpie-server/contract-tests there is a testrail.cfg.dist file. To enable reporting of results to TestRail, that file needs to be modified and the following values added to it:

* email address for TestRail user (I suggest creating a Normandy-specific one)
* password for TestRail user
* assignedto_id is the TestRail ID for the user

Then the results can be reported by adding the following CLI options to the `pytest` command already being used:

* `--testrail=testrail.cfg` to use the TestRail config file
* `--no-ssl-cert-check` so that Python doesn't complain about the self-signed SSL certificate being used by our TestRail instance

You'll notice that are tests in `test_heartbeat` that have a `@testrail` annotation. Any tests that don't have one already will need one. You can set those test cases up in TestRail itself and then add the necessary annotation.

Happy to answer any questions about all this.
